page.title: 17St James _ Friends and Bells
page.content: The Friends of St James was formed in recent years to raise money for the Church Fabric Fund. Events held throughout the year include Lectures and Buffet Suppers, Farm Visits, and Houses and Gardens open for visitors. The bells of St James's date from 1602_1927 and are rung on Fridays and Sundays by an active band of local ringers. At present there is a core of 9 ringers plus beginners who not only ring at Egerton but give valuable support to other towers in the area. In 1985 the band has had 2 ringing outings to other districts, played host to the Ashford District Annual Call Change Competition (and won it), a New Year's dinner party for about 20 ringers and a barbecue for Egerton and Charing ringers. We also ring for weddings and at Christmas ring carols on handbells around the village.
